ca.mcgill.ecse211.model

Class LightLocalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.model.LightLocalizer

  • public class LightLocalizer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the light localization of the robot.
    Author:
    Carlo D'Angelo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int COLOUR_DIFF
      As the robot spins and the color sensor records the brightness of the playing field, if a percent change in brightness that is greater than this value (i.e., 20%) is recorded, then the robot knows that a grid line has been detected.
      private float[] csData 
      private SampleProvider csLineDetector 
      private static int EXTRA_DISTANCE
      The robot moves this distance (cm) towards the localization point before starting light localization.
      private EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor 
      private static double LIGHT_LOC_DISTANCE
      Distance (cm) between the color sensor and the axis of rotation of the robot.
      private double[] linePosition 
      private Navigation navigator 
      private Odometer odo 
      private EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor 
      private static int ROTATION_SPEED
      Rotation speed (in degrees/second) of the robot during most of the light localization.
      private static int ROTATION_SPEED_SLOW
      Rotation speed (in degrees/second) of the robot during the end of the light localization.
      private double TILE_SIZE 
      private static double TURN_ERROR

    • Field Detail

      • ROTATION_SPEED_SLOW

        private static final int ROTATION_SPEED_SLOW
        Rotation speed (in degrees/second) of the robot during the end of the light localization. NOTE: Please refer to Software Document - Section 3.3 for detailed explanations of why we decrease the speed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROTATION_SPEED

        private static final int ROTATION_SPEED
        Rotation speed (in degrees/second) of the robot during most of the light localization.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TILE_SIZE

        private final double TILE_SIZE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • COLOUR_DIFF

        private static final int COLOUR_DIFF
        As the robot spins and the color sensor records the brightness of the playing field, if a percent change in brightness that is greater than this value (i.e., 20%) is recorded, then the robot knows that a grid line has been detected. NOTE: Please refer to Software Document - Section 3.3 for detailed explanations of how the light localization process actually works.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LIGHT_LOC_DISTANCE

        private static final double LIGHT_LOC_DISTANCE
        Distance (cm) between the color sensor and the axis of rotation of the robot.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_DISTANCE

        private static final int EXTRA_DISTANCE
        The robot moves this distance (cm) towards the localization point before starting light localization.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        private static final double TURN_ERROR
        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • LightLocalizer

        public LightLocalizer(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                      EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                      SampleProvider csLineDetector,
                      float[] csData,
                      Navigation navigator)
               throws OdometerExceptions
        This is the default constructor of this class.
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - left motor of robot
        rightMotor - right motor of robot
        csLineDetector - sample provider from which to fetch light sensor data
        csData - array in which to receive the light sensor data
        navigator - instance of Navigator class
        Throws:
        OdometerExceptions

    • Method Detail

      • lightLocalize

        public void lightLocalize(double pointX,
                          double pointY)
        Method that allows the robot to perform light localization.
        Parameters:
        pointX - x coordinate of desired localization point
        pointY - y coordinate of desired localization point

      • moveClose

        public void moveClose()
        Method that moves the robot closer to the localization point in preparation for the actual light localization.

      • readLineDarkness

        private float readLineDarkness()
        Method that fetches data from the light sensor.
        Returns:
        darkness (value between 0-1) of what the light sensor is reading multiplied by 1000
